flawed_nl_solution:
She wants to send a dozen carnations that cost $4/dz to each of her 5 teachers, so 4*5 = $<<4*5=20>>20
She has 14 friends and she knows a dozen carnations is cheaper than buying 12 single carnations. So 14-12 = <<14-12=6>>6 single carnations are needed
A single carnation cost $0.5 so 6*0.5 = $<<6*0.5=3>>3
All total she will spend 20+4+3 = $<<20+4+3=27>>27 on carnations
#### 27

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 2, not 6. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
